Get the...---- # Pod2Hive - Podcast Censorship Protection This Podcast is being automatically backed up to the Hive Blockchain. [You can find more information about this project here.](pod2hive) To Decode the RSS feed stored alongside this data, use the [rssfromhive.py](https://github.com/brianoflondon/pod2hive/blob/main/rssfromhive.py) script. You can also fetch this data as a Json object with the following line: ```curl -s --data '{"jsonrpc":"2.0", "method":"database_api.find_accounts", "params": {"accounts":["hive-account"]}, "id":1}' https://api.hive.blog``` The Json object returned will contain a ['pod-rss'] entry - this can be unpacked by running a bas64 decode followed by a zlib decompression.

You can also fetch this data as a Json object direct from the Hive API with the following line: ```curl -s --data '{"jsonrpc":"2.0", "method":"database_api.find_accounts", "params": {"accounts":["no-agenda"]}, "id":1}' https://api.hive.blog``` The Json object returned will contain a ['pod-rss'] entry - this can be unpacked by running a bas64 decode followed by a zlib decompression.

[Episode 22: This Train is Rolling - audio/mpeg](https://mp3s.nashownotes.com/PC20-22-2021-01-29-Final.mp3) [Show Notes Link](http://adam.curry.com/html/PC202220210129Podcas-Kj8pLFSLVvbMMq2jz3bxJH9p0Rjm4B.html) Published: Fri, 29 Jan 2021 19:33:50 +0000 # Podcast: Podcasting 2.0 [Original RSS Feed](http://mp3s.nashownotes.com/pc20rss.xml)

Shownotes

Podcasting 2.0 for January 29th 2021 Episode 22: This Train is Rolling!

The man who Spends $16 dollars to learn 64 new languages - Dave Jones!

Crank those value sliders up everyone!

Download the mp3

Preservepodcasting.com

Check out the podcasting 2.0 apps and services newpodcastapps.com

Support us with your Time Talent and Treasure

Shownotes

Adam & Dave discuss the week's developments on podcastindex.org

Languages seemed like a big deal

Podstation v4v

... PodcastIndex.org ID: 1568994914 -------- # Pod2Hive - Podcast Censorship Protection ## Experimental API to extract RSS from Hive Use the following call: ```http://hive.noagendahost.com/hiverss/v1/rss/podcastindex``` [http://hive.noagendahost.com/hiverss/v1/rss/podcastindex](http://hive.noagendahost.com/hiverss/v1/rss/podcastindex) You can also extract the same info as json: ```http://hive.noagendahost.com/hiverss/v1/json/podcastindex?pretty=true``` [http://hive.noagendahost.com/hiverss/v1/json/podcastindex?pretty=true](http://hive.noagendahost.com/hiverss/v1/json/podcastindex?pretty=true) ## More info This Podcast is being automatically backed up to the Hive Blockchain. [You can find more information about this project here.](https://github.com/brianoflondon/pod2hive) To Decode the RSS feed stored alongside this data, use the [rssfromhive.py](https://github.com/brianoflondon/pod2hive/blob/main/rssfromhive.py) script. You can also fetch this data as a Json object direct from the Hive API with the following line: ```curl -s --data '{"jsonrpc":"2.0", "method":"database_api.find_accounts", "params": {"accounts":["podcastindex"]}, "id":1}' https://api.hive.blog``` The Json object returned will contain a ['pod-rss'] entry - this can be unpacked by running a bas64 decode followed by a zlib decompression.
